fields.name: Ben Thanh market
fields.description: Iconic market selling souvenirs and local food in the center of HCMC

fields.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral of Saigon
fields.description: French-built cathedral with twin bell towers

fields.name: Independence Palace
fields.description: Historic building showcasing presidential rooms and war command bunkers reflecting Vietnam's political changes and important events during the twentieth century.

fields.name: Saigon Central Post Office
fields.description: Classic French colonial building designed by Gustave Eiffel featuring ornate ceilings and active postal counters.

fields.name: Landmark 81
fields.description: Vietnam tallest building featuring luxury shops fine dining and observation decks with breathtaking skyline views.

fields.name: Tao Dan park
fields.description: Central green park perfect for jogging relaxing and bird watching amidst Saigonâ€™s busy center.

fields.name: Le Van Tam park
fields.description: Family-friendly city park with trees benches and community events on weekends.

fields.name: Gigamall Thu Duc
fields.description: Gigamall is a new style shopping center, a great combination of shopping and entertainment experience, JP World, cuisine paradise, shopping paradise.

fields.name: Tan Phu AOEN Mall
fields.description: Japanese-style shopping complex with restaurants cinema and spacious layout suitable for families.

fields.name: HCMC Nguyen Van Binh book street
fields.description: Famous pedestrian street full of bookshops, cafes, and mini exhibitions.

fields.name: War remnants Museum
fields.description: the Museum of thematic research, collection , storage, preservation and display of the material, photographs, artifacts on the evidence of the crime and the consequences of the war that the invasion force has caused to Vietnam
